title: NCW forms panel to probe Bhopal rape and blackmail cases; five survivors come out
content: The Bhopal police had earlier formed a special investigation team (SIT) which is currently probing the cases.

title: CPI(M) opposes approval of Sainik School named after M.P.’s Minister’s late nephew; alleges criminal record against him
content: The NGO was formed in May 2023 after the death of Maninagendra Singh alias Monu Patel, son of Mr. Patel’s brother and former BJP MLA Jalam Singh Patel.

title: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh meets West Bengal CM Mamata at Digha Jagannath temple, draws party ire
content: State BJP president Sukanta Majumdar said that Dilip Ghosh’s visit does not have endorsement of the party.

title: Digha’s Jagannath Temple will be an important pilgrimage for centuries,  says West Bengal CM; opens its door for public
content: The ₹250 crore temple has been built over 20 acres of land is similar to the 12th century temple at Puri of the same deities

title: VACB arrests Kochi Corporation official on charge of taking bribe
content: The building inspector of the Corporation’s zonal office at Vyttila, had allegedly sought ₹15,000 for processing an application seeking a building number

title: NGT slams Collector for not filing action-taken report on Thripunitura explosion
content: The Southern Bench of the tribunal said in its order dated April 25, 2025, that the report by the District Collector had not been filed yet, despite several opportunities being offered

title: Reinstated int'l students at risk again after new ICE memo on SEVIS terminations
content: A new ICE memo threatens international students whose SEVIS records were recently reinstated, potentially creating gaps in their records and jeopardizing their legal status. This policy allows for SEVIS termination based on visa revocations, raising concerns about due process and potential deportation. Immigration attorneys anticipate legal challenges to address these issues and protect students from adverse consequences.

title: In charged atmosphere, Pak chases ghosts of IAF fighters
content: Pakistan received an official warning about a potential Indian military offensive, leading to heightened tensions and claims of airspace violations. Amidst denials of involvement in a terrorist attack and accusations of escalating tensions, both sides face domestic pressures and international calls for dialogue. With authorized operational freedom for forces and family relocations, the risk of conflict looms large.

title: Caste census BJP's bid to stop erosion of broader Hindu unity
content: The Indian government's decision to include caste enumeration in the upcoming census aims to consolidate Hindu unity and counter attempts to divide the population along caste lines. Sources suggest the move, following discussions between PM Modi and RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, intends to prevent the splintering of the OBC-Dalit-Muslim coalition.

title: What's keeping Xi awake at night? Hint: It's not Trump
content: Donald Trump faces global scrutiny. Xi Jinping confronts internal challenges. Purges within China's military raise concerns about loyalty. Key generals have disappeared. Xi aims for a fourth term in 2027. He needs to show stability. Trump's tariffs create an external enemy. Economic slowdown and military instability pose threats. Xi's grip on power faces tests. The world watches China's internal dynamics.

title: Apple CEO on US-made iPhones: I don’t like to employ all these people foreign, but...
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook told Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick that advanced robotics are essential for bringing iPhone manufacturing to the U.S. Amid tariff concerns, Apple secured a temporary exemption, aiding stock recovery. While diversifying production to India, challenges persist with Chinese export approvals, framing this shift as part of an AI-driven industrial revolution with high-paying technician jobs.

title: Pahalgam fallout: India bars all planes operated by Pakistan from its airspace
content: India has prohibited Pakistan-registered aircraft, including military planes, from using its airspace, effective from midnight April 30-May 1 until May 23, 2025. This restriction applies to all aircraft registered in Pakistan or operated by Pakistani entities, covering all Indian airspace regions.

title: Amazon CEO to business leaders on Trump tariffs: At the end of the day...
content: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy advises business leaders to prioritize customer focus amidst tariff and geopolitical uncertainties. He acknowledges the challenging environment created by tariffs but emphasizes fulfilling the core mission of understanding and delivering what customers want. Jassy believes concentrating on controllable factors and customer needs positions companies for success, despite external pressures.

title: SC seeks Centre response on 'illegal clinical trials' in Gujarat
content: The Supreme Court has requested the central government's response to an NGO's claims of 58 illegal clinical trials conducted by pharmaceutical companies at an Ahmedabad hospital. These trials allegedly lacked the mandatory ethical committee, violating New Drugs and Clinical Trials Rules, 2019.

title: Pahalgam attack: Hit-back set to be calibrated, short of full-fledged conflict
content: Following the Pahalgam massacre, India is considering punitive military actions against Pakistan, focusing on long-range strikes without crossing the LoC. The Indian Army has been authorized to respond decisively to terrorism, with plans in place for calibrated responses.

title: Google making changes to salary structure: What it means for employees
content: Google is revamping its performance review system to allocate larger bonuses and equity awards to high-achieving employees, potentially decreasing compensation for those with lower performance ratings. This adjustment, set to influence end-of-year reviews and 2026 compensation, aims to incentivize top contributors. While some employees may receive reduced bonuses, Google maintains its commitment to competitive compensation and benefits.

title: Everything I saw at RSS school started to unfold at BHU: JNUSU president Nitish Kumar
content: Mr. Kumar, JNUSU’s new president from Left Unity, reflects on his early exposure to one side of the ideological spectrum and search for an alternative

title: Police zero in on kingpins behind recent drug trafficking cases in Kozhikode
content: Involvement of more foreign nationals suspected; anti-narcotics squad reportedly makes headway in identifying smugglers’ networks

title: Caste census: After declining it for years, RSS leader backs caste census
content: Mr Joshi, on several occasions in the past, had declined the idea of caste census and so did the RSS, the ideological parent of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

title: U.S. urges India and Pakistan to ‘de-escalate’; Marco Rubio talks to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif
content: “We are in touch with the governments of India and Pakistan, not just at the Foreign Minister level, but at multiple levels,” says Washington

title: India closes its airspace to airlines from Pakistan
content: Sources said that a NOTAM (Notice to Airmen) has been issued that bars Pakistan airlines from using the Indian airspace.

title: Police register FIR after Aligarh school student is forced to urinate on Pakistan flag
content: Targeting the student in this manner created divisions in society and helped Pakistan’s agenda, the Congress said

title: NDA partners and Opposition celebrate Centre’s decision to conduct caste count
content: Both Samajwadi Party and RJD have claimed victory for themselves, with former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav claiming that the decision is a result of “collective pressure”, while leader of opposition in Bihar assembly Tejashwi Yadav termed it “ideological victory”. At the same time, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar commended the decision, Lok Janshakti Party (Ramvilas) leader & Union Minister Chirag Paswan said the government has neutralised the opposition with this move

title: Costa Coffee sees rising sips grow its India business
content: Costa Coffee is aggressively expanding in India, targeting 40-50 new outlets annually, despite global economic uncertainties. The company sees India as a high-potential market, driven by a growing preference for premium coffee among millennials and Gen Z.

title: Man loses interim custody of kid for failing to give home-cooked food
content: The Supreme Court overturned a Kerala High Court order granting a father interim custody of his eight-year-old daughter, citing concerns about the child's well-being. The father, working in Singapore, couldn't provide home-cooked meals or companionship, unlike the mother who works from home and has family support. The court also deemed the 15-day custody of the three-year-old son as detrimental.

title: 'How does this help country?': Trump takes another jab at Taylor Swift
content: Donald Trump mentioned Taylor Swift during the Philadelphia Eagles' White House visit. He referred to her being booed at Super Bowl LIX. Swift's fans reacted angrily to Trump's comments on social media. They criticized him for involving her in unrelated matters. This isn't the first time Trump has publicly expressed dislike for Swift.

title: Heartbreak at Attari: Couples separated, kids left behind
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, a government directive has led to the expulsion of numerous Pakistani nationals, primarily women married to Indian men, creating emotional turmoil at the Attari-Wagah border. Sara Khan, a new mother, was forced to leave despite her recent C-section and her baby's Indian citizenship. Other families face separation, highlighting the human cost of the policy.

title: IPL: Chahal hat-trick, Shreyas special knock CSK out of playoffs race
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's sensational hat-trick dismantled Chennai Super Kings, while Shreyas Iyer's brilliant 71 propelled Punjab Kings to a four-wicket victory, ending CSK's playoff hopes. Curran's explosive 88 initially boosted CSK to 190, but Chahal's game-changing spell restricted them. Prabhsimran Singh's quickfire 54 set the stage for PBKS's chase, securing a crucial win and moving them to second in the standings.

title: Centre's big caste census move: Masterstroke or political compulsion?
content: The Centre announced a nationwide caste count alongside the next population census, reversing its previous stance. Opposition leaders claimed victory, asserting their persistent demands compelled the government's change of heart. The govt claimed its decision was to address concerns over non-transparent state-level caste enumerations being carried out in opposition ruled states.

title: India warns Pakistan against violating ceasefire along LoC
content: Following Pakistan's unprovoked firing along the LoC, the DGMOs of India and Pakistan spoke via hotline, with India issuing a strong warning. This occurred amidst rising tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack, where 26 tourists were killed. The CCS, headed by PM Modi, met to discuss India's response, granting the armed forces operational freedom regarding retaliation.

title: RJ Mahvash’s viral reaction on Chahal’s hat-trick
content: Yuzvendra Chahal took a hat-trick for Punjab Kings against Chennai Super Kings. He dismissed MS Dhoni and three others in a single over. This performance shifted the game's momentum. RJ Mahvash praised Chahal on social media. Her post sparked interest due to dating rumours. Chahal's figures were four for 32. This was his second IPL hat-trick.

title: Former RAW chief to head revamped national security advisory board
content: In the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack and emerging Pakistan links, the Centre has revamped the National Security Advisory Board (NSAB). Former RAW chief Alok Joshi has been appointed as chairman, leading a team of 14 experts from diverse fields. This reconstitution aims to strengthen intelligence gathering and analysis to counter Pakistan-sponsored terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Kashmiri Pandit org flags ‘revived existential threat’ to community in Valley
content: A Kashmiri Pandit organisation, KPSS, has threatened mass migration from Kashmir Valley if immediate security isn't provided around their settlements and religious sites. Citing intelligence reports of imminent danger from TRF, KPSS President Sanjay Tickoo demanded community-specific protection.

title: Watch: Yuzi Chahal's meme-inspired viral celebration after hat-trick
content: Yuzvendra Chahal delivered a game-changing performance for Punjab Kings against Chennai Super Kings, claiming a hat-trick and four wickets in a single over. His exceptional bowling not only restricted CSK to 190 but also etched his name in IPL history. Chahal's unique celebration, inspired by his own memes, added to the excitement, marking a memorable moment in the 2025 season.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after CSK vs PBKS match
content: Punjab Kings showcased an all-round performance, dismantling Chennai Super Kings' playoff aspirations with a four-wicket victory at Chepauk. Yuzvendra Chahal's game-changing hat-trick restricted CSK to 190, while Shreyas Iyer's commanding 72 guided Punjab to a crucial win. This defeat officially eliminates CSK from the IPL 2025 playoff race, while Punjab climbs to second in the standings.

title: 'Trying to steal credit': BJP slams Rahul's remark on caste census decision
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi welcomed the union cabinet's decision to conduct a caste census, emphasising it as the initial step towards comprehensive social reform. He urged the government to provide a clear timeline for completion, highlighting public and political pressure as key drivers.

title: Chahal claims hat-trick, becomes bowler with most four-fors in IPL - Watch
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's sensational hat-trick against Chennai Super Kings derailed their innings, achieving multiple milestones. Playing for Punjab Kings, Chahal's brilliance in the 19th over led to four wickets in six balls, restricting CSK to 190. This performance included dismissing MS Dhoni and marked Chahal's ninth four-wicket haul in the IPL, setting a new league record.

title: Dhoni hits six; Jadeja catches: What happened - Watch
content: In a bizarre IPL 2025 moment, MS Dhoni's six landed in Ravindra Jadeja's hands near the boundary. Yuzvendra Chahal's final over dismantled CSK, dismissing Dhoni and claiming a hat-trick. Despite Sam Curran's 84 and Ayush Mhatre's 76, a dramatic collapse saw CSK lose five wickets for 18 runs, finishing at 190. Chahal's brilliance and CSK's batting frailties defined the innings.

title: Why Khalistanis are the biggest losers of Canadian election
content: The federal election didn’t just retire the idea that stumbling through woke homilies and imaginary genders is politics — it also retired the last shreds of political legitimacy clung to by Canada’s Khalistani proxies. From Ontario to British Columbia, the message was clear: you can’t run a country while moonlighting as the foreign ministry for a fictitious ethno-theocracy with a proclivity to blow up planes. Unless one is America, of course.

title: Four panchaloha idols of Adi Shankarcharya made near Swamimalai to be installed at Kedarnath, Badrinath
content: A team of 15 artisans proficient in chiseling, designing, engraving and polishing among others were involved in making the idols in sitting posture giving them an antique finish

title: Ministers from about 30 countries confirm participation in WAVES summit; PM Modi to inaugurate the event on Thursday
content: Th event aims to position India as a creative and technological force across industries, from cinema and television to AI, immersive reality, gaming, and digital media

title: Easy for States to get ration from Centre and distribute it for free, but burden is on taxpayers: SC
content: Hearing petitions on food security, court says employment generation and infrastructure development are also important; asks if nation is still stuck at same poverty levels as in 2011, when last Census was done

title: Despite High Court order, J&K policeman and eight siblings shifted to Punjab for repatriation to Pakistan
content: “He has worked in the J&K Police for 26 years. How did he become a Pakistani,” asks constable Ifthikar Ali’s wife; hundreds of Pakistani women married to Indians being targeted for removal despite decades of residence

title: DGMOs hold talks as Pakistan ceasefire violations spread in J&K
content: “India warned Pakistan against the unprovoked violations by Pakistan Army along the LoC,” official sources said

title: Three more coaches for Bengaluru metro’s Yellow Line shipped from Titagarh
content: The Yellow Line is expected to significantly reduce traffic congestion and enhance connectivity to major corporate hubs such as Infosys and Biocon

title: Caste count seen as a strategic move by government to weaken Opposition plank
content: The announcement, which comes ahead of the Bihar Assembly polls, has longer-term implications too; the outcome is likely to open avenues for new political negotiations, coalitions, and party politics as well as emergence of new aspirations

title: Rahul Gandhi meets family of Pahalgam attack victim in U.P.’s Kanpur
content: Calls for special Parliament session; Congress seeks martyr status for deceased, urges stern action against perpetrators

title: CoE for polymer science, rubber technology opens in Mysuru
content: Dr. D Banerjee Centre of Excellence of the Indian Rubber Institute has come up on the campus of JSS Technical Institutions

title: Shivraj Chouhan questions Congress’s track record on caste census
content: Union Agriculture Minister criticises Rahul Gandhi, says Congress must explain past inaction before claiming credit

title: A tariff-ic century? 100 key decisions Trump took since returning to White House
content: Donald Trump's return to the White House has triggered significant policy shifts within his initial 100 days. He swiftly dismantled established norms through executive orders, impacting trade, environmental regulations, and immigration policies. These actions included imposing substantial tariffs on Chinese goods, leading to retaliatory measures and economic uncertainty. Trump also targeted cultural institutions and implemented workforce reductions, alongside regulatory rollbacks, sparking both economic changes and legal challenges.

title: Income taxpayers note! New ITR-1, ITR-4 forms notified for FY 2024-25 - Details
content: The CBDT has released ITR forms 1 and 4 for the financial year 2024-25, applicable for income earned from April 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025. A key change allows ITR-1 filers to include long-term capital gains from listed equity shares and equity mutual funds up to Rs 1.25 lakh.

title: Watch: Hardik Pandya runs across the ground to hug Rahul Dravid
content: Ahead of their IPL 2025 match, Hardik Pandya and Rahul Dravid, India's former coach, shared a heartwarming reunion in Jaipur. Dravid, recovering from an injury, stood to greet Pandya, reminiscing about their T20 World Cup victory. The emotional visuals, shared by Rajasthan Royals, quickly went viral, highlighting the special bond between the two cricket figures.

title: Centre has approved caste census: What is it and why it matters
content: India is set to include caste enumeration in its upcoming census, a practice discontinued post-independence except for SCs and STs. This decision, driven by political and social demands, aims to provide insights into caste-based socio-economic disparities. The data could reshape affirmative action policies and address inequalities, though some fear it may reinforce divisions.

title: 'Don't know if I'm coming for the next game': Dhoni on retirement query
content: MS Dhoni playfully teased fans about his IPL future after losing the toss against Punjab Kings, leaving them guessing about his return next season. He then discussed CSK's home form and frequent team changes due to inconsistent performances following the auction. Shreyas Iyer, winning the toss, opted to field, revealing Glenn Maxwell's injury and an undecided replacement.

title: US economy contracts 0.3% in Q1 2025; Trump blames it on Biden 'overhang’
content: The US economy unexpectedly contracted by 0.3% in the first quarter of 2025, falling short of expectations. This downturn is attributed to a surge in imports ahead of President Trump's new tariffs and a deceleration in consumer and government spending. While Trump blames Biden, his advisor cites pre-tariff import activities as the cause.

title: Trent Boult on bowling to 14-yr-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi: 'Going to be ...'
content: Trent Boult of Mumbai Indians anticipates facing Rajasthan Royals' Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Boult acknowledges Suryavanshi's impressive form. He sees it as an exciting challenge. Boult praises Suryavanshi's fearless approach. Mumbai Indians are on a five-match winning streak. They aim to improve further. The match between Mumbai Indians and Rajasthan Royals is crucial.

title: India can hit Pak by regulating water flow timing, denying data
content: While immediate stoppage of water flow to Pakistan is difficult due to infrastructure limitations, India can regulate flow during winter using existing dams, potentially impacting Pakistan's wheat crop. To exert greater control, India needs to expedite hydropower projects and increase water storage capacity. Abeyance of the Indus Water Treaty allows India to strategically manage its river resources, enhancing water security.

title: Watch: What happened after Kuldeep slapped Rinku Singh
content: Following a tense IPL match between Delhi Capitals and Kolkata Knight Riders, a playful interaction between Kuldeep Yadav and Rinku Singh went viral, showcasing their strong off-field camaraderie. Despite Rinku's earlier aggressive batting against Kuldeep, the video captured laughter and friendship, highlighting the positive spirit amidst the competition. KKR secured a 14-run victory, keeping their playoff hopes alive.

title: Skylar Diggins confirms removing her husband’s name as she embraces new chapter
content: Skylar Diggins will now be known as Skylar Diggins, dropping her husband's name. The WNBA player confirmed this during the Seattle Storm's media day. Fans noticed the change on her social media. Diggins expressed excitement for the upcoming season. She highlighted the team's talent after a major trade. The Storm secured the No.2 overall pick in the 2025 draft.

title: US stock markets open sharply lower as economic contraction sparks selloff
content: US markets opened in red as the economy unexpectedly shrank by 0.3% in the first quarter, driven by increased imports and slower consumer spending. The decline raised concerns about President Trump's tariff policies, with the Dow, Nasdaq, and S&P 500 all experiencing significant drops. European and Asian markets showed mixed reactions amidst global trade uncertainties.

title: Govt announces caste survey will be part of next census; Vaishnaw slams Cong
content: The Union Cabinet has decided to include a caste enumeration in the upcoming national census, as announced by Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He criticized the Congress party for their alleged historical opposition to such a census, while also pointing out the non-transparent and politically motivated caste surveys conducted by some state governments.

title: Bangladesh court gives bail to Chinmoy Das in sedition case
content: A Bangladesh court granted bail to former Iskcon leader Chinmoy Krishna Das in a sedition case after his arrest sparked widespread outrage. The charges stemmed from the hoisting of a saffron flag above Bangladesh's official flag during a rally in Chattogram. Das, spokesperson for a minority rights group, advocates for Hindu community reforms and organized large public rallies.

title: Amid water row with Punjab, Haryana Opposition leaders demand action on SYL project
content: The SYL project was envisaged as a 214-km canal, with 122 km to be constructed in Punjab and the remaining 92 km in Haryana; while Haryana has completed its portion of the project, Punjab, which initiated construction in 1982, shelved it subsequently

title: Mann Ki Baat is a one-way street, while debate is the defining character of democracy: Siddaramaiah
content: At Basava Jayanti celebration, he says government will consider various demands to spread Sharana ideology

title: 10 Civil Service officers, 2025 rank-holders to lead sessions at The Hindu Civil Service Gateway Summit
content: Aspirants can explore course offerings, access preparation materials, and speak to mentors from India’s top-rated UPSC academies at the summit

title: Vizhinjam Port to be dedicated to nation by PM on Friday
content: V.N. Vasavan says formal handover of port will take Kerala to the forefront of the world’s maritime trade

title: Govt. negligence caused Simhachalam tragedy: YSRCP
content: Vellampalli Srinivas cites repeated temple tragedies under NDA. Questions the credibility of inquiry committees, pointing to the unsolved probe into the Tirupati stampede

title: Siddaramaiah welcomes Centre’s decision on caste census, but says there should be socio-economic survey too
content: Rahul Gandhi has put a lot of pressure on the Centre by sustaining the momentum for caste census for many years now and the Centre has yielded to the pressure of the Congress and its leaders, says CM

title: State govt. nod to engage IIT Madras as consultant to study structural flaws at flat complex
content: Residents of the apartment complex have been on the warpath after almost every unit reported substantial leakage, including from bathrooms, since the first showers in February 2024

title: Bihar leaders welcome Modi government’s move of caste enumeration to be included in next Census
content: CM Nitish, Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary thank PM for caste enumeration decision; but RJD says this has been the party’s long-pending demand and there is ‘still a lot of work to be done’

title: LDF govt. recast ‘inequitable’ Vizhinjam port contract to Kerala’s advantage, says CM
content: CM says the initial contract signed by the Cong. govt. deprived the State of profit from the port’s operations for the first two decades, despite Kerala bearing 60% of the cost. The LDF govt. then signed an even-handed supplementary concession contract annulling the original deed, he says

title: A. Jayathilak succeeds Sarada Muraleedharan as Chief Secretary of Kerala
content: Jayathilak, who was serving as Additional Chief Secretary (Finance), is the 50th Chief Secretary of the State

title: Drug cases: apartments under scanner in Kochi
content: Two prominent Malayalam film directors and a rapper were nabbed with suspected ganja from two different apartments in the city on successive days

title: A.P. Minister announces 3% quota for sports persons in DSC
content: Of the 16,347 teacher posts in the State, 421 have been allocated for people applying under the sports quota, says Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy

title: Firm seeks three months to repair escalator at moffusil bus stand in Kozhikode
content: The escalator is part of the first-ever mechanised foot overbridge in the State, which connects the bus stand with the V.K. Krishnamenon Indoor Stadium across Rajaji Road

title: Anita Ratnam moves Madras High Court against infringement of her personality rights
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy directs Meta Platforms Inc and Telegram FZ-LLC to take down fake Facebook accounts and Telegram channels that had misused her photos, videos and voice

title: Maratha row: Manoj Jarange Patil to launch indefinite fast in Mumbai on August 29
content: The activist has accused the State of reneging on quota promises; warns of large-scale mobilisation if demands remain unmet

title: 64% of Simhachalam temple redevelopment works are completed so far, says Endowments Minister
content: Anam Ramanarayana Reddy expresses shock over the death of seven devotees in the wall collapse incident at the temple

title: Belichick defends girlfriend from 'false narrative'
content: North Carolina coach Bill Belichick issued a statement defending girlfriend Jordon Hudson from the "false narrative" that she was trying to control his interview with CBS.

title: Elway's business partner dies from fall injuries
content: Jeff Sperbeck, the longtime friend, business partner and former agent of John Elway, has died from injuries suffered when he fell off a golf cart reportedly being driven by the Hall of Fame quarterback.

title: Angels' Trout leaves game with apparent injury
content: Angels outfielder Mike Trout left Wednesday's game at Seattle with an apparent injury after trying to leg out a ground ball.

title: Rockies avoid worst 30-game start since 1901
content: The Rockies (5-25) beat the Braves to end an eight-game losing streak and avoid tying the 1988 Orioles (4-26) for the worst 30-game start in MLB since 1901.

title: Barça battle back for draw in goalfest with Inter
content: Barcelona twice battled back to draw 3-3 at home against Inter Milan in a rip-roaring first leg of their Champions League semifinal in Olympic Stadium at Montjuïc on Wednesday.

title: Jets QB Travis retiring due to '23 FSU leg injury
content: Jets quarterback Jordan Travis announced his retirement after a devastating leg injury suffered in 2023 while at Florida State "never responded" to treatment.

title: Giants' Carter also got prank call during draft
content: Giants rookie pass rusher Abdul Carter also received a prank call during the NFL draft, agent Drew Rosenhaus told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Mammoth gaffe? Utah mum on name after leak
content: Utah Hockey Club officials wouldn't confirm whether "Mammoth" was their new name after it allegedly leaked on the team's official YouTube channel Tuesday night.

title: The Rockets will enter the offseason in search of a star
content: Only one young player is untouchable as the Rockets enter an offseason with lucrative draft capital and a promising future.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Elimination games on tap, and a pivotal Game 5 in Jets-Blues
content: Will the playoff field shrink Wednesday night? Here are keys to each game, plus Tuesday's recaps, Three Stars.

title: Barça, Inter, Yamal deliver perfect Champions League night
content: Barça-Inter didn't go to script, and that unpredictability made for a brilliant Champions League semifinal.

title: College Football Playoff impact: Players who stuck around
content: The portal has closed, the draft is over, so who are the best players who stuck around even though they had options?

title: What another disappointing first-round loss means for Giannis and the Bucks: 'I don't know'
content: Year 2 of the Giannis-Dame partnership was supposed to fuel a title run in Milwaukee. Where can the franchise turn now after another first-round exit?

title: Damian Lillard's injury timeline, plus what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: The Bucks guard faces a long recovery, but there is precedent for stars in their 30s making a full comeback.

title: From Rory to JT, looking back at top players and moments
content: Through half of the 2025 season we've seen Rory McIlroy dominate, Justin Thomas get back in the winner's circle and Scottie Scheffler start a bit slower than expected.

title: Ronaldo's trophy wait goes on after ACL Elite exit
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's wait for a major trophy in Saudi Arabia is set to continue as Al-Nassr lost 3-2 to Kawasaki Frontale in the Asian Champions League semifinals on Wednesday.

title: Rajasthan Chief Minister Directs Police To Deport Bangladeshi Immigrants
content: Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma on Wednesday directed police to launch a campaign against illegal Bangladeshi immigrants.

title: High Court To Hear Plea Against Robert Vadra Over Pahalgam Remarks Tomorrow
content: The Allahabad High Court will on Friday hear a petition filed against Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's husband, Robert Vadra, over his remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: IPS Officer Behind 26/11 Attacks Probe Takes Charge As Mumbai  Police Chief
content: Senior IPS officer Deven Bharti, who has been a part of probes into many high-profile cases, including the 26/11 terror attacks, on Wednesday took over as the new commissioner of Mumbai police.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: India Shuts Airspace For Pakistan, Blocks Pak Actors' Insta Handles
content: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: India has warned Pakistan against its unprovoked firings along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu & Kashmir, amid escalating tensions over the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Ayodhya's Hanuman Garhi's Head Seer Breaks Tradition To Visit Ram Temple
content: Mahant Prem Das became the first head seer of Ayodhya's Hanuman Garhi to step outside the revered temple's premises in over 300 years as he led a procession to the Ram temple on Akshaya Tritiya festival.

title: Air Marshal N Tiwari To Take Over As Vice Chief Of Air Staff
content: Air Marshal Narmdeshwar Tiwari, currently serving as the Air Officer Commanding-in-Chief of the South Western Air Command, is set to take charge as the new Vice Chief of the Air Staff on May 2.

title: RSS Chief Performs Key Ritual At Wedding Of 125 Women On Akshaya Tritiya
content: On the auspicious occasion of Akshaya Tritiya, Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat performed mass kanyadaan of 125 women in the Akshaya Kanyadan Mahotsav organised at Shankul Dhara in Varanasi on Wednesday.

title: 'Won't Initiate, But Respond Strongly If...': Pak Amid Tensions With India
content: Pakistan on Wednesday said it has nothing to do with the Pahalgam terror attack and threatened a strong response if it is "provoked", amid rising tensions with India.

title: India Closes Airspace For All Pak Flights Days After Kashmir Terror Attack
content: Six days after Pakistan decided to shut its airspace to all flights owned and operated by Indian carriers, New Delhi has announced a reciprocal move by shutting down its airspace to all Pakistan owned and operated planes.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi Participates In 'Lights Off' Protest Against Waqf Law
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday participated in the 'switching off lights' protest called by the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) against the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Video: Karnataka Driver Stops Bus To Offer Namaz, Probe Ordered After Complaints
content: The driver of a state transport bus in Karnataka has landed in trouble after stopping the bus on the roadside to offer namaz. An inquiry has been ordered after a video of him at prayer was widely circulated.

title: Music Stopped, Lights Turned Off At Wedding Hall As Fire Engulfs Adjacent Hotel
content: The music stopped, food was left unfinished and the lights of the illuminated wedding hall of a central Kolkata dharamshala were turned off, as a major fire in an adjacent hotel left 14 people dead.

title: Centre's Caste Census Move In Interest Of 140 Crore Citizens: Yogi Adityanath
content: The Centre's decision to include caste-based data in the upcoming national census is "unprecedented" and in the interest of 140 crore citizens, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said on Wednesday.

title: "Mere Announcement Not Enough": Mallikarjun Kharge To NDTV On Caste Census
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday welcomed the Centre's decision to include caste-based data in the upcoming national census but stressed that a mere announcement without any effort to initiate the exercise is not enough.

title: Cabinet Nod To Shillong-Silchar Highway Project Worth Rs 22,864 Crore
content: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday approved the development of a 166.80 km greenfield high-speed corridor from Mawlyngkhung in Meghalaya to Panchgram in Assam on hybrid annuity mode at a total cost of Rs 22,864 crore.

title: 6 Members Of A Family Drown In River In Gujarat's Kheda: Cops
content: Six members of a family, most of them teenage cousins, drowned in a river in the Kheda district of Gujarat on Wednesday evening, police said.

title: Bangladesh Supreme Court Orders Stay On Bail To Hindu Monk Chinmoy Das
content: The Appellate Division of the Bangladesh Supreme Court on Wednesday evening stayed the High Court order given earlier in the day granting bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, or Chandan Kumar Dhar, the former ISKCON monk.

title: Liga MX Femenil player gets 6-yr match-fixing ban
content: The Mexican Football Federation (FMF) on Tuesday handed a six-year ban to an unnamed Liga MX Femenil player from Mazatlán FC after an investigation into match-fixing.

title: Marinakis gives up control of UCL-chasing Forest
content: Evangelos Marinakis has taken a step back from his ownership duties at Nottingham Forest as the club gear up for Champions League qualification.

title: Sources: Ancelotti's move to Brazil hits impasse
content: Real Madrid are unhappy with the timing and financial arrangements of Carlo Ancelotti's exit from the club, leaving his reported move to take over as coach of the Brazil national team in jeopardy, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Athletic aim for Williams stay amid Barça, PL links
content: Ernesto Valverde has said he's hopeful Athletic Club can fend off interest from Barcelona and the Premier League and keep Nico Williams in Bilbao next season.

title: Sources: Dier agrees to join Monaco as free agent
content: Bayern Munich defender Eric Dier has agreed to join Monaco as a free agent when his contract expires in the summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Wrexham to hold stadium promotion party for fans
content: Wrexham is keeping the party going after sealing a third-straight promotion by throwing a ticket-only end-of-year awards ceremony for fans.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Ovechkin, Caps favored to advance in Game 5
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Top 10 transfer portal winners: SEC leads the pack
content: Whether remaking rosters or filling needs, Tennessee, Ole Miss, South Carolina and LSU won the transfer portal.

title: Transfer rankings: All eyes on Kneepkens, Williams
content: Ta'Niya Latson tops the rankings, while Gianna Kneepkens and Serah Williams still have decisions to make.

title: 2024-25 report cards for every Big East team (plus a few others)

title: Bracketology: Debut predictions for the 2025-26 season

title: F1's next wave is here, and it starts with Antonelli, Bearman

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye move for $54M-rated Rashford

title: Home theater, bowling alley and more highlight Deion Sanders' former home listing
content: Sanders' former mansion, which includes a number of impressive amenities, sits on 5.95 acres of land in Texas.

title: Ukrainian Journalist Tortured, Had Organs Removed In Russian Custody: Report
content: Belousov also noted that Roshchyna's body showed signs of an autopsy having been performed before it was returned to Ukraine, and that some of her organs were missing.

title: Amul Hikes Milk Prices By Rs 2 Per Litre Across All Variants In India
content: Prices of Amul milk across all variants in the country will be raised by Rs 2 per litre with effect from May 1 (Thursday), the marketing federation which owns the popular dairy brand announced on Wednesday.

title: 'They tell you to keep it down -- don't listen': 30 years of Coors Field horror stories

title: NBA playoff odds: Lakers, Rockets favored at home Wednesday
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Golden State Warriors , Minnesota Timberwolves and Denver Nuggets are in an odds tier ranging from 18-1 to 33-1 . on Wednesday it's the Rockets (-4.5) and Lakers (-6.5) who are favored at home to extend the series to a Game 6 .
